alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 12:41PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Johnson. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 PM MDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in Highway 190 between Kaycee and Barnum. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Highway 190 between Kaycee and Barnum is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Highway 196 also has some low water crossing that may be impacted. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kaycee and Barnum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
